pageContext.description:
Butt of a Bronze Age (c. -1500 to c. -950) palstave: The copper alloy fragment is a sub rectangle with one terminal being broken, but not recently. The opposite edge tapers slightly in width and also tapers to a blunt point in thickness. The long edges on both faces have a slight lip.



The upper and lower surface of the fragment has an incomplete shiny dark green patina which has small and large pitting.



The fragment measures 31.14mm in length, 23.38mm in width and 9.09mm thickness and weighs 29.9g.



The fragment is the butt of a palstave and dates to the middle Bronze Age (c. -1500 to c. -950).
